alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued March 02 at 10:34AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Continued ponding water in low lying areas and on roadways through Thursday... Area covered- Lincoln County, including the Fisher and Yaak Rivers. Timing of the event- Through Thursday evening An additional half inch of precipitation is expected in the valleys with one to two inches in the terrain over the next 36 hours, mostly as rain below 5500 feet. Due to saturated ground, standing water on roads and in low lying or poor drainage areas will continue. This will also increase the potential for rock and mud slides. Stream and river rises will occur but flooding is not expected at this time. The situation is expected to improve once colder air lowers snow levels on Friday.
